section.heading: Denial of license application and suspension and revocation of licenses

content.p: Fraud or bribery in securing a license;\n
Incompetency in the operation of a pet cemetery or pet\ncrematorium;\n
Failure to display the license as provided in this article;\n
Violation of any provision of this article, or of any rule or\nregulation adopted hereunder;\n
Failure to retain all pet disposal forms for a period of two years\nfollowing receipt;\n

Conviction of a violation of article twenty-six of the agriculture
and markets law involving cruelty to animals.
 2. Whenever the license to engage in the business of operating a pet
cemetery or pet crematorium is revoked, such license shall not be
reinstated or reissued until after the expiration of a period of five
years from the date of such revocation and the secretary of state
approves the license application pursuant to section seven hundred
fifty-e of this article.
